abstract: The SEC has no proof a Hong Kong couple had inside information on Rupert Murdoch’s bid for Dow Jones, but that did not stop it from freezing their profits.
snippet: The SEC has no proof a Hong Kong couple had inside information on Rupert Murdoch’s bid for Dow Jones, but that did not stop it from freezing their profits.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission today persuaded a federal judge to freeze the profits of a Hong Kong couple who made $8 million by buying stock in Dow Jones from April 13 to April 20, and then selling it last Friday. The 415,000 shares they bought accounted for 3 percent of the volume during the period.
